question.xref: DES s6, HC p102, KYTS p119

explanation.text: The white line is generally positioned so that pedestrians have room to cross in front of waiting traffic. Don’t move off while pedestrians are crossing, even if the lights change to green.

answer.text: you must stop behind the white stop line
you may go straight on if there is no other traffic
you may turn left if it is safe to do so
you must slow down and prepare to stop if traffic has started to cross
